tn.text: Though Yahweh was speaking directly to Joshua, all occurrences of you include Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]])
The words "crossed over" refer to going to the opposite bank of the river. AT: "went across" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
the Jordan River (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

The nested quote can be stated as an indirect quote. AT: "Give them this command to take up twelve stones from the middle of the Jordan where the priests are standing on the dry ground, and bring them over with you and lay them down in the place where you will spend the night tonight" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotesinquotes]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
Joshua tells the twelve men what to do.

tn.ref: into the middle of the Jordan. Each of you is to take up a stone upon his shoulder
tn.text: Each of the twelve men were to pick up a large stone from the Jordan River bed and carry them to the other side to build a monument. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Joshua tells Israel what the pile of twelve stones mean.

tn.ref: The waters of the Jordan were cut off before the ark of the covenant of Yahweh
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh cut off the waters of the Jordan in front of the ark of his covenant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: The waters of the Jordan were
tn.text: "The Jordan River was"

tn.ref: were cut off before the ark
tn.text: The Jordan River was prevented by God from flowing up to the ark that was being carried by the priests.

tn.ref: the waters of the Jordan were cut off
tn.text: The water flowing down the Jordan River stopped before the ark so everyone including the ark traveled on the dry river bed.
Joshua and Israel continue to do as Yahweh commanded.

tn.ref: they picked up twelve stones from the middle of the Jordan
tn.text: This refers to the twelve men picking up stones from the middle of the Jordan River bed. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: Then Joshua set up twelve stones in the middle of the Jordan
tn.text: These were twelve additional stones, not the stones that the twelve men carried from the river bed. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: The memorial is there to this day
tn.text: This means the memorial was there to the day that the author was writing this book.
This refers to the Jordan River. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] or [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This refers to the nation of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This means to go to the opposite bank of the river. AT: "traveled from one side to the opposite side" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This refers to being in front of the people or in the sight of all the people. Everyone saw the ark being carried by the priests. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: The tribe of Reuben, the tribe of Gad, and the half tribe of Manasseh passed before the people of Israel formed up as an army
tn.text: These were the soldiers of the 3 tribes that were fulfilling their obligation to lead the Israelites into battle for settling on the East side of the Jordan River. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The word "they" refers to the people of Israel.
This refers to not just honor but submission to his commands and to treat him as the commander of their army as they had followed Moses. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Yahweh tells Joshua to have the priests exit the Jordan River.
The Author was making it clear that parting the Jordan River was no different than parting the Red Sea for the previous generation.

tn.ref: waters of the Jordan returned to their place and overflowed its banks
tn.text: The Jordan River was overflowing its banks and flooding the area before and after Israel passed through on dry land.
"4 days" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: came up out of the Jordan
tn.text: This refers to when Israel crossed the Jordan River on dry ground.

tn.ref: on the tenth day of the first month
tn.text: This is the first month of the Hebrew calendar. The tenth day is near the end of March on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: The twelve stones that they took out of the Jordan
tn.text: Each tribe was to take one stone from the Jordan River so Joshua could build a memorial of the crossing event. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Joshua continues to remind the people the purpose of the pile of stones.
It was for Israel to teach their children of God's miracles so that they would honor Yahweh forever.

tn.ref: the hand of Yahweh is mighty
tn.text: This refers to the power of Yahweh being strong. AT: "Yahweh is mighty" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
